unnormalised: The race for seats in Delhi University (DU) is heating up, with the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores now out. This yr, things feel even more competitive, if that’s even possible! My niece, Aisha, is aiming for a B.A. (Hons) in English at Hindu College.
normalised: The race for seats in Delhi University (D-U) is heating up, with the Common University Entrance Test (C-U-E-T) scores now out. This year, things feel even more competitive, if that's even possible! My niece, Aisha, is aiming for a Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in English at Hindu College.

unnormalised: Aisha scored 780/800, a fantastic score, but she’s still worried. Last yr, cutoffs for similar programs were sky-high. Plus, there are so many students from CBSE and other boards vying for limited spots. It's honestly nerve-wracking to watch her go through this! She’s been studying practically 12 hrs a day for months.
normalised: Aisha scored seven hundred and eighty divided by eight hundred, a fantastic score, but she's still worried. Last year, cutoffs for similar programs were sky-high. Plus, there are so many students from C-B-S-E and other boards vying for limited spots. It's honestly nerve-wracking to watch her go through this! She's been studying practically twelve hours a day for months.

unnormalised: The grapevine is buzzing with rumours about predicted cutoffs. Some say that a score of 790+ might be needed for the top colleges for subjects like Economics and Political Science. It’s madness! The pressure on these kids is unreal. I remember when admission was based on 12th marks and it felt less stressful, but maybe I’m just remembering things through rose-tinted glasses.
normalised: The grapevine is buzzing with rumours about predicted cutoffs. Some say that a score of seven hundred and ninety plus might be needed for the top colleges for subjects like Economics and Political Science. It's madness! The pressure on these kids is unreal. I remember when admission was based on twelfth marks and it felt less stressful, but maybe I'm just remembering things through rose-tinted glasses.

unnormalised: DU's admission portal is now open and Aisha has already registered and filled out her preferences. Fingers crossed that she gets her first choice. I just hope she remembers that her worth isn't defined by a number or a college.
normalised: D-U's admission portal is now open and Aisha has already registered and filled out her preferences. Fingers crossed that she gets her first choice. I just hope she remembers that her worth isn't defined by a number or a college.

unnormalised: I think this CUET system needs some serious re-evaluation. It’s turned the whole process into a high-stakes game. Wishing all the students, including Aisha, the very best! May they all get into the colleges and courses of their dreams (or at least something close to it!).
normalised: I think this C-U-E-T system needs some serious re-evaluation. It's turned the whole process into a high-stakes game. Wishing all the students, including Aisha, the very best! May they all get into the colleges and courses of their dreams (or at least something close to it!).
